title: Married Life in Krishna Consciousness Movement | Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa | SB 3.22.11 | 13.08.2024
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: The household duty of a man is not to satisfy his sense gratification but to remain with a wife and children and at the same time attain Advancement in Spiritual Life
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difference between a true householder (Grahastha) and one who is simply attached to household life (Grahamedhi), emphasizing spiritual advancement.

segments.key_quote: So Prabhupada always said forget all this, you are servant of Krishna, just serve Krishna. Those are all incidental.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that serving Krishna is the most important thing, and that the different ashramas are secondary.

segments.key_quote: Where there is chanting, maya cannot enter.
segments.summary: The speaker describes how chanting the Hare Krishna mantra protects devotees from the anxieties of material existence, especially in Kali Yuga, and provides a unique, sheltered environment.

segments.key_quote: We are having a liberated life actually.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the difficulties faced by those trying to practice Krishna consciousness while working outside the devotee community with the liberated life experienced within the Hare Krishna movement due to Srila Prabhupada's mercy.

segments.key_quote: He is giving you everything. From food to everything he is giving.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of recognizing and appreciating the blessings received through Srila Prabhupada, including prasadam, Vaishnava association, and freedom from material struggle.

segments.key_quote: To make them chant Hare Krishna Mahamantra one round, two rounds. Start like that.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the power of the Hare Krishna mantra to change lives and emphasizes that Prabhupada's focus was on preaching Krishna consciousness rather than becoming ideal householders.

segments.key_quote: Practically Prabhupada engaged everybody in Seva of the Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Prabhupada practically engaged everyone in the service of the Lord, emphasizing that the Hare Krishna movement is a movement of the holy name.

segments.key_quote: All those things are immaterial. Really immaterial.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that while we can learn about Vedic life from the scriptures, Prabhupada gave us a practical path of service to Krishna, making other considerations immaterial.

segments.key_quote: What benefits that soul today in this Kali Yuga is Krishna Consciousness preaching
segments.summary: The speaker shares examples of how Srila Prabhupada prioritized spreading Krishna consciousness over conventional Grahastha life, even sending newly married couples with infants to open centers.

segments.key_quote: When you have no energy, you chant, what will you do
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the challenges faced by congregation members who work long hours outside the temple, making it difficult to maintain a strong spiritual practice.

segments.key_quote: India is also completely imitating the west
segments.summary: The speaker laments the increasing influence of Western work culture in India, which hinders spiritual progress, and contrasts it with Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's call for Indians to become gurus for the world.

segments.key_quote: Every one of us are an example of the leela of the holy name
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Prabhupada's books and the holy name are the saving grace, and that every devotee's life is a reciprocation with the holy name, lifting them out of ignorance.

segments.key_quote: I am a male now is just a big cheating
segments.summary: The speaker explains that chanting the Hare Krishna mantra properly leads to the realization that identifying oneself as male or female is a temporary illusion.

segments.key_quote: The consciousness where you are situated in Jnana that I am not this body
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna says that true consciousness is being situated in knowledge, understanding that one is not the body.

segments.key_quote: You are watching, you are a seer and scene is different
segments.summary: The speaker answers a question about how consciousness interacts with the 24 elements, explaining that the soul is the seer and the 24 elements are the seen, but illusion causes us to identify with the body.

segments.key_quote: Soul is always spirit, it's always Brahman
segments.summary: The speaker continues to explain that the soul is always spirit and that the illusion of identifying with the body is a thought within the soul.

segments.key_quote: I think I am this body but when knowledge comes oh I am not this body
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of a rope seen as a snake to illustrate how knowledge dispels the illusion of identifying with the body, and explains that determination and conviction are affected by the three modes of nature.

segments.key_quote: Material world people love each other it's all identified love it's not real love of the soul
segments.summary: The speaker explains that we live a life of identification, and that detachment from matter is needed to disidentify, requiring spiritual strength and knowledge.

segments.key_quote: Without getting that punya, one cannot come into Krishna consciousness.
segments.summary: The speaker answers a question about spiritual convictions, explaining that they are also affected by the modes of nature, and that serving the Guru helps one develop the necessary punya and sattva guna.

segments.key_quote: Life itself is a characteristic of spirit.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the Kshetra imitates the spirit, creating a sense of identity and convictions, and that even reading scriptures is initially done with karmic values, but slowly one can lift oneself up to the spiritual level.
